qas.question: What are some of the cable TV networks owned by Comcast?

answers.text: E! Entertainment Television, the Golf Channel, and NBCSN

qas.question: What two national over-the-air broadcast entities are owned by Comcast?
What company did Comcast propose a merger with?
What date did Comcast drop their proposed merger agreement with Time Warner?

plausible_answers.text: U.A.E., South Korea, Russia and China

qas.question: What countries is Comcast planning to open new attractions in?
When did the deal with Time Warner officially go through?

plausible_answers.text: E! Entertainment Television, the Golf Channel, and NBCSN

qas.question: What are the names of the cable-only channels by Time Warner?
How many entertainment venues does Time Warner have?

context: Comcast operates multiple cable-only channels (including <a0_0><b7_0>E! Entertainment Television, the Golf Channel, and NBCSN<b7_0/><a0_0/>), over-the-air national broadcast network channels (<a1_0>NBC and Telemundo<a1_0/>), the film production studio <a2_0>Universal Pictures<a2_0/>, and Universal Parks & Resorts, with a global total of nearly <b8_0>200<b8_0/> family entertainment locations and attractions in the U.S. and several other countries including <b5_0>U.A.E., South Korea, Russia and China<b5_0/>, with several new locations reportedly planned and being developed for future operation. Comcast also has significant holding in digital distribution (thePlatform). In February 2014 the company agreed to merge with <a3_0>Time Warner Cable<a3_0/> in an equity swap deal worth <b9_0>$45.2 billion<b9_0/>. Under the terms of the agreement Comcast was to acquire 100% of Time Warner Cable. However, on <a4_0><b6_0>April 24, 2015<b6_0/><a4_0/>, Comcast terminated the agreement.
